subject: Marketing
title: The Power of Context
description: One-minute skill: The Power of Context.

hook.text: New York's crime rate plummeted in the 1990s. The cause? Cleaning subway graffiti.

buildup.text: Small environmental cues signal social norms. Broken windows invite more crime.

discovery.text: Context shapes behavior more than personality. Environment is the hidden persuader.

twist.text: Marketing messages land differently depending on where and when people see them.

climax.text: The same ad in a hospital feels different than on a beach billboard.

punchline.text: Context doesn't frame the message. It is the message.

quiz.question: How does context affect viral marketing messages?
options: The environment where people see content changes its impact
Context has no effect on how messages are received
Only the message content matters, not the setting
